alert.note: Alert for Butte; Custer (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 11:37AM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pocatello has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Idaho... Antelope Creek near Darlington affecting Butte and Custer Counties. .Flow levels continue to decrease with isolated flood impacts still possible along the creek. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pocatello. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Antelope Creek near Darlington. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding possible along stretches of Antelope Creek from the Grouse area downstream to the Big Lost River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...Creek levels should remain within action stage fo the next few days. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Antelope Creek Darlington 6.0 6.0 Thu 11 am MD MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
